conclusion: The bullet (mass m) is fired into the ping-pong ball (mass M). The combined mass (M + m) moves horizontally after the collision.
Using conservation of momentum: mv_0 = (M + m)v
The combined mass falls from height h and travels a horizontal distance s.
The time t it takes to fall from height h can be calculated using: h = (1/2)gt^2, solving for t: t = sqrt(2h/g)
The horizontal distance s is related to the horizontal velocity v and time t: s = vt, substituting t: s = v sqrt(2h/g)
Solving for v: v = s/sqrt(2h/g) = s sqrt(g/2h)
From the momentum equation, solve for v_0: mv_0 = (M + m) v, v_0 = ((M + m) v)/m, substituting v: v_0 = ((M + m) s sqrt(g/2h))/m
Final expression for v_0: v_0 = ((M + m) s)/m sqrt(g/2h)
The exit velocity of the bullet can be expressed as: v_0 = ((M + m) s)/m sqrt(g/2h)
